text: the surrounding residential, worker and student community as well as visitors to Central London. Wentworth Street is designated as a CAZ Retail Cluster in the London Plan and includes a particularly significant cluster of clothing and fabric shops and hosts Petticoat Lane Market, which has been in operation for at least 400 years. Spitalfields is locally designated and includes the well-known covered market as well the adjacent streets to the south, which contain a mixture of food and drink businesses that contribute to the evening and night-time economy. Aldgate South (within the Goodmanâ€™s Fields development) is locally designated and primarily serves the surrounding high-density residential community, but also includes businesses that attract customers from further afield, including a cinema.
